event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU), the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: An uncorrectable error was detected on a DMA channel between two MBC chips on two different FRUs. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
An uncorrectable error was detected on a DMA channel between two MBC chips on two different FRUs.

There are two DMA channels between MBC chips.

If the first DMA channel fails, then the system will switch to using the second DMA channel.

The XSCF will no longer be able to contact the chips and devices that are connected to the faulty MBC chip.



   SPARC Enterprise M3000 platform:


      MBC chip is on the XSCFU, with the later actually being part of the Motherboard Unit (MBU).

      If the fault involves the MBC chip on the Motherboard (this can be
      determined by examining the FMRI of the fault), then the platform will
      gradually become unbootable as domains try to reboot.

      If the MBC chip is on an XSCFU and this is the first DMA channel on the MBC chip to fail,
      then nothing is deconfigured.

      If the MBC chip is on an XSCFU and the second DMA channel fails (dma_ch=1 in the FMRI of the ereport),
      then the MBC chip loses contact with all the other MBC chips connected to the XSCFU.
      This means that if the MBC chip on the XSCFU fails, the platform becomes unmanageable.



   SPARC Enterprise M4000 platform:

      MBC chip is on the XSCFU.

      If the fault involves the MBC chip on the Motherboard (this can be
      determined by examining the FMRI of the fault), then the platform will
      gradually become unbootable as domains try to reboot.

      If the MBC chip is on an XSCFU and this is the first DMA channel on the MBC chip to fail,
      then nothing is deconfigured.

      If the MBC chip is on an XSCFU and the second DMA channel fails (dma_ch=1 in the FMRI of the ereport),
      then the MBC chip loses contact with all the other MBC chips connected to the XSCFU.
      This means that if the MBC chip on the XSCFU fails, the platform becomes unmanageable.

  


    SPARC Enterprise M5000 platform:

      MBC chip is on the XSCFU.
    
      The precise MBC chip that has the problem sometimes cannot be identified.
      In such cases, the FMRI for the ereport and the fault does not specify an MBC chip.

      If the fault involves the MBC chip on the Motherboard (this can be
      determined by examining the FMRI of the fault), then the platform will
      gradually become unbootable as domains try to reboot.

      If the MBC chip is on an XSCFU and this is the first DMA channel on the MBC chip to fail,
      then nothing is deconfigured.

      If the MBC chip is on an XSCFU and the second DMA channel fails (dma_ch=1 in the FMRI of the ereport),
      then the MBC chip loses contact with all the other MBC chips connected to the XSCFU..
      This means that if the MBC chip on the XSCFU fails, the platform becomes unmanageable.



   SPARC Enterprise M8000 platform:

  
      If the MBC chip is on a BP_A Backplane:
      The platform cannot be restarted after the next platform reset or  power-off.

      If the MBC chip is on a CMU: The CMU with the faulty chip will gradually be deconfigured;
      domains will  not be allowed to use XSBs on this CMU as domains reboot or domains stop
      using the XSBs due to DR operations.

      If the MBC chip is on an XSCFU or XSCFU_C  and  this is the first DMA channel on the MBC chip to fail,
      then nothing is deconfigured.

      If the MBC chip is on an XSCFU or XSCFU_C  and this is the second DMA channel on the MBC chip to fail,
      then the XSCFU and  its partner XSCFU_C are deconfigured.

      If the MBC chip is on the XSCFU, the XSCFU will fail over to the standby XSCFU.



   SPARC Enterprise M9000-32 platform:

 
      If the MBC chip is on a CMU: The CMU with the faulty chip will gradually be deconfigured;
      domains will  not be allowed to use XSBs on this CMU as domains reboot or domains stop
      using the XSBs due to DR operations.

      If the MBC chip is on an XBU:
      The crossbar way with this XBU is deconfigured the next time the platform  is restarted.

      If the MBC chip is on a CLKU:
      If this is the active CLKU, then the CLKU is deconfigured the next time the platform is restarted.
      If this is the standby CLKU, the CLKU is deconfigured immediately.

      If the MBC chip is on an XSCFU or XSCFU_C  and  this is the first DMA channel on the MBC chip to fail,
      then nothing is deconfigured.

      If the MBC chip is on an XSCFU or XSCFU_C  and this is the second DMA channel on the MBC chip to fail,
      then the XSCFU and  its partner XSCFU_C are deconfigured.

      If the MBC chip is on the XSCFU, the XSCFU will fail over to the standby XSCFU.


   SPARC Enterprise M9000-64 platform:


      If the MBC chip is on a CMU: The CMU with the faulty chip will gradually be deconfigured;
      domains will  not be allowed to use XSBs on this CMU as domains reboot or domains stop
      using the XSBs due to DR operations.

      If the MBC chip is on an XBU:
      The crossbar way with this XBU is deconfigured the next time the platform  is restarted.

      If the MBC chip is on a CLKU:
      If this is the active CLKU, then the CLKU is deconfigured the next time the platform is restarted.
      If this is the standby CLKU, the CLKU is deconfigured immediately.

      If the MBC chip is on an XSCFU or XSCFU_C  and  this is the first DMA channel on the MBC chip to fail,
      then nothing is deconfigured.

      If the MBC chip is on an XSCFU or XSCFU_C  and this is the second DMA channel on the MBC chip to fail,
      then the XSCFU and  its partner XSCFU_C are deconfigured.

      If the MBC chip is on the XSCFU, the XSCFU will fail over to the standby XSCFU.




The recommended service action for this event is to schedule the replacement of the affected FRU.

       LEGEND

      RED        = SUNW-MSG-ID
      BLUE     = EVENT_ID
      GREEN  = FRU


Step 1. Collect the fault message (use one of the following methods):


   Single-line fault message displayed on the XSCF console:

   Mar 20 21:22:44 san-ff2-21-0 fmd: SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12, CSN: 7860000772  
   EVENT-ID: 8cac43fb-97ef-496c-96ae-5af9aed785f4
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8003-M3 for detailed information.


   Complete fault message using 'fmdump -m' on the XSCF console:

   MSG-ID: SCF-8003-M3, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Major
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 20 21:22:44 UTC 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: 7860000772, HOSTNAME: san-ff2-21-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: 8cac43fb-97ef-496c-96ae-5af9aed785f4
   DESC: An uncorrectable error was detected on a DMA channel between two MBC chips on two
   different FRUs. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
   Refer to http://www.sun.com/msg/SCF-8003-M3 for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: There are two DMA channels between MBC chips. If the first DMA channel fails, the system
   will switch to using the second DMA channel. If the second DMA channel fails, then the
   FRU with the MBC chip becomes unmanageable. If the second DMA channel fails, then resources
   associated with the FRU with the MBC chip will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or
   after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed.
   Deconfiguration of these resources may reduce system performance or may cause the
   platform to become unbootable. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for
   additional information.
   IMPACT: If it is the second DMA channel for the MBC chip that has failed, the XSCF will no longer be able
   to contact the chips and devices that are connected to the faulty MBC chip.
   REC-ACTION: Schedule a repair action to replace the affected Field Replaceable Unit (FRU),
   the identity of which can be determined using fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID.
   Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.


Step 2. Collect the output from the 'fmdump -v -u EVENT_ID' command

   
   SPARC Enterprise platform example:
 
   xscf> fmdump -v -u 8cac43fb-97ef-496c-96ae-5af9aed785f4

         TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
         Mar 20 21:22:44.1631 8cac43fb-97ef-496c-96ae-5af9aed785f4 SCF-8003-M3
           100%  fault.chassis.SPARC-Enterprise.asic.mbc.se-dma

                 Problem in: hc:///chassis=0/xscfu=0/mbc=0
                    Affects: hc:///chassis=0/xscfu=0
                        FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassis-id=7860000772:
                             server-id=san-ff2-21-0:
                             part=CA20393-B56X 001AA:revision=0101/component=/XSCFU



Step 3. Contact your Authorized Service Provider.



If you require additional information, please refer to InfoDoc #87402.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: If it is the second DMA channel for the MBC chip that has failed, the XSCF will no longer be able to contact the chips and devices that are connected to the faulty MBC chip.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: There are two DMA channels between MBC chips. If the first DMA channel fails, the system will switch to using the second DMA channel. If the second DMA channel fails, then the FRU with the MBC chip becomes unmanageable. If the second DMA channel fails, then resources associated with the FRU with the MBC chip will be deconfigured after the platform is power cycled or after the domain reboots or after a Dynamic Reconfiguration operation is performed. Deconfiguration of these resources may reduce system performance or may cause the platform to become unbootable. Please consult the detail section of the knowledge article for additional information.
event_registry_properties.name: title
event_registry_properties.item: Uncorrectable error detected on DMA channel between MBC chips.
